name: Deliverance: Stormlord II
description:
As in Stormlord, you must rescue as many fairies as possible, on this occasion by catching them out of the sky as they fall. This isn't as easy as it sounds, because this scrolling platform shooter has many sections in which the fairies are falling towards fiery pits, and you must catch them without hitting this pit.

The controls allow you to jump, and then jump again while falling, so you can, with effort, climb most of the way up the screen. The forces of the Black Queen are out to stop you, including spiders, bats and goblins, and even the clouds and stalactites on the ceilings launch deadly droplets of distilled doom. A bonus level is offered sporadically, allowing you to collect coins for extra lives - although you start with 9, you'll need them, as the levels are long and treacherous.
alsoFor: Amiga, Amstrad CPC, Antstream, Atari ST, Commodore 64, Macintosh | Combined View

shot.caption:
Game selection.
The game is in three parts. The player has the option to choose which part to play
Game controls. After pressing 'UP' (9 on the numeric keypad) the player defines the keys to be used for Left, Right, Jump, Duck, and Fire. Restarts return to this screen.
The game always starts by showing the current score to be beaten
The Credits screen is displayed if the player stays at the Game Menu screen long enough. Then the two screens alternate.

This is the start of Part 1. The pink lady is just decoration. 
The green bat thing is deadly, in fact contact with most things will cost a life
Stormlord gets to shoot things. The little round red bubble is deadly and cannot be shot
Crossing the lake of poisonous bubbles cost 2 lives. Stormlord can land on the white bubble though it does sink into the lake under his weight. From that bubble he can get the thing on the platform
Whatever that thing was it appears in the window at the bottom of the screen
Faries! Stormlord is supposed to catch them
Jumping into a fairy saves her, but Stormlord then lands in the sea of deadly red bubbles and loses a life. The supply of fairies is limited. This is not a continuous stream
Once past the fairies Stormlord cannot go back to the left of the screen. The next section is filled with little green men who hurl fireballs. Contact with them, or their balls, is deadly
Game over. After this its back to the Game Controls menu
